author: Rick Spilman
content: Could be. Pity that Butts wasn’t named Schr√∂dinger. We could have had it both ways.

author: Ron Wilkinson
content:
Wayne White did a display of cutout monumental sculpture at Virginia’s MOCA contemporary art museum called the Monitorium exploring events around the battle of Hampton Roads where the ironclads met on the James River.
https://virginiamoca.org/wayne-white-monitorium

author: Dick B
content:
Possible he did as he says he did, and the tompions simply pulled out of the muzzles in the swirl of a sinking ship. They were wooden, and only made for a hand fit, not bolted on.

I’d prefer my version.
